alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Harnett; Lee; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 3:49PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A slow moving storm producing heavy rain will impact portions of north central Harnett, northeastern Lee, southwestern Wake and southeastern Chatham Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 346 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Fuquay-Varina, or 14 miles northeast of Sanford. This storm was nearly stationary. Rainfall up to an inch has already fallen. HAZARD...Heavy downpours and up to 30 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rain may lead to localized flooding especially in poor drainage locations. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fuquay-Varina, Broadway, Harris Lake Boat Launch, Moncure, Seminole, Shearon Harris Reservoir, Duncan, Raven Rock State Park and Jordan Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
